I
October 2, 1956
Mr. Marvin D. Miller
Station Supervisor KNER
Buckner Orphans Horae
Route 4
Dallas, Texas
Dear Mr. Miller*
In reply to your request of September 26, I am happy to give you more in¬
formation about the NAEB. Incidentally, I suspect that some of ray earlier
correspondence to your organization has been misplaced. I set forth the
dues and advantages of membership in my original letter of April 7, 1955,
and then repeated this informa tion again, as a result of a request from
Mr. R. H. Lunda- who was then Station Supervisor, in a letter dated Septem¬
ber 8, 1955.
From your recent letter I gather that you do have the various publications
and other materials I sent originally, and those will give you an idea of
some of the services we provide. In addition to these miscellaneous re¬
ports all members receive our monthly Newsletter (copies of which were sent
to you earlier), and we are always ready and willing to help you with any
specific problems you may have. We also make available certain grants each
year to permit the production of outstanding radio programs, and this year
we have instituted a series of Research Grants. I am enclosing copies of
these announcements for your information.
We are constantly ranking efforts to upgrade the professional abilities of
educational broadcast rs through scholarships, seminars and workshops. This
past summer we held three such meetings: one in TV Program Planning, one in
TV Staging and Lighting and one in Radio Engineering. All of these were paid
for by us at no cost to the participants.
